summary: This document is an email chain from May 2019 between a U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutor and FBI personnel. It discusses obtaining contact information for a potential victim/witness, referred to as 'Vicky,' and planning initial contact and an in-person interview in California. The email provides background on Vicky's alleged connection to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Vicky
persons.context: Referred to as a potential victim of Jeffrey Epstein who was met while in high school. The email states she has not been interviewed by law enforcement and her name appears in one FBI 302 report.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as having met Vicky while she was in high school and that she was apparently one of his victims.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in the background on Vicky, stating that Epstein bought a house for Maxwell and that Maxwell was also a recruiter.

connections.description: The email states Epstein met Vicky while she was in high school and that she was apparently one of his victims.
The email references that Epstein bought a house for Maxwell and that Maxwell was also a recruiter, implying a collaborative relationship in the alleged scheme.
The connection is implied through the context of Maxwell being a recruiter and Vicky being a victim, suggesting Maxwell may have been involved in recruiting Vicky.

events.title: Planning Contact with Potential Witness
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI coordinate to obtain contact information and plan to call and potentially travel to California to meet with a potential victim/witness named Vicky.

keyFacts: The document reveals an active investigation by the SDNY and FBI into Jeffrey Epstein as of May 2019, focusing on contacting potential victims.
It identifies a potential victim/witness, 'Vicky,' who was allegedly met by Epstein while she was in high school and had not previously been interviewed by law enforcement.
The email confirms Ghislaine Maxwell's alleged role as a recruiter for Epstein and mentions Epstein bought a house for her.
The correspondence shows prosecutorial and law enforcement coordination to carefully make initial contact with a potential witness, including offering assistance with legal counsel.
